skill.name: alphafold-database
skill.description: Access AlphaFold's 200M+ AI-predicted protein structures. Retrieve structures by UniProt ID, download PDB/mmCIF files, analyze confidence metrics (pLDDT, PAE), for drug discovery and structural biology.
skill.summary: Access AlphaFold's 200M+ AI-predicted protein structures. Retrieve structures by UniProt ID, downloa...
skill.author: davila7

security_audit.summary: Pure documentation skill with no executable code. Contains markdown documentation and example Python code snippets for accessing public AlphaFold DB APIs. All network calls are to legitimate scientific databases (alphafold.ebi.ac.uk, uniprot.org, Google Cloud). No sensitive data access, no code execution, no persistence mechanisms.

content.user_title: Access AlphaFold protein structures by UniProt ID
content.value_statement: AlphaFold DB provides over 200 million AI-predicted protein structures. This skill helps researchers retrieve structure files, analyze confidence scores, and integrate predictions into computational pipelines for drug discovery and structural biology.
actual_capabilities: Retrieve AlphaFold predictions by UniProt accession ID
Download structure files in PDB, mmCIF, or bcif formats
Analyze pLDDT confidence scores and PAE matrices
Access bulk proteome data via Google Cloud Storage
Query AlphaFold metadata using BigQuery SQL
Parse and visualize protein structures with BioPython
limitations: Only single-chain structures available (no multi-chain complexes)
Predictions lack ligands and post-translational modifications
Requires internet connection for API access
Rate limits apply to REST API requests

use_cases.title: Obtain protein models
use_cases.description: Download predicted structures for proteins without experimental data for comparative analysis and annotation.

use_cases.title: Analyze binding sites
use_cases.description: Retrieve target protein structures and assess confidence metrics for virtual screening and docking studies.

use_cases.title: Build analysis pipelines
use_cases.description: Integrate AlphaFold API calls into automated workflows for large-scale proteome processing.

prompt_templates.title: Get single protein
prompt_templates.prompt: Get the AlphaFold structure for UniProt ID P00520. Download the mmCIF file and summarize the protein.

prompt_templates.title: Compare proteins
prompt_templates.prompt: Compare pLDDT confidence scores between proteins P12931 and P04637. Which has more high-confidence regions?

prompt_templates.title: Bulk access
prompt_templates.prompt: Find all human proteins in AlphaFold DB with very high confidence (pLDDT > 90) using BigQuery. List the top 10 by sequence length.

prompt_templates.title: Visualization
prompt_templates.prompt: Download the PAE matrix for protein P00520 and explain the domain arrangement confidence based on the error values.

output_examples.input: Get the AlphaFold structure for protein ABL1 (P00520) and analyze its confidence scores
output: High confidence regions (>90): Many residues, particularly in kinase domain
Low confidence regions (<50): Predominantly in disordered N-terminal region

best_practices: Cache downloaded structure files locally to avoid repeated API requests
Use Google Cloud Storage for bulk proteome downloads instead of individual REST API calls
Validate prediction confidence (pLDDT > 70) before downstream structural analysis
anti_patterns: Using REST API for bulk downloads (inefficient, may hit rate limits)
Assuming all predictions are equally reliable (always check confidence scores)
Ignoring PAE values when analyzing multi-domain protein arrangements

faq.question: Which AI tools support this skill?
faq.answer: Works with Claude, Claude Code, and Codex. Requires Python environment with requests and Biopython.

faq.question: What file formats are available?
faq.answer: mmCIF (recommended), binary CIF (compressed), and legacy PDB format. Also JSON for confidence data.

faq.question: How many structures are in AlphaFold DB?
faq.answer: Over 200 million protein structure predictions from UniProtKB, covering most known proteins.

faq.question: Is the data safe to use?
faq.answer: Yes. AlphaFold DB is public data from DeepMind/EMBL-EBI. No credentials required for access.

faq.question: Why are some regions low confidence?
faq.answer: Intrinsically disordered regions and flexible loops are harder to predict. Check pLDDT scores to identify unreliable regions.

faq.question: How does this compare to PDB?
faq.answer: PDB contains experimental structures. AlphaFold provides computational predictions for any protein with a known sequence.
